skill.name: website-maintainer
skill.description: Use this skill when working on the Repomix documentation website in `website/` directory, including VitePress configuration, multi-language content, or translation workflows.
skill.summary: Use this skill when working on the Repomix documentation website in `website/` directory, including ...
skill.author: yamadashy

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only metadata files and documentation about VitePress site structure. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file access capabilities are present. Pure prompt-based documentation skill.

content.value_statement: Keeping multilingual documentation consistent across 14 languages is slow and error prone. This skill provides clear paths and rules to update VitePress content and configuration safely.
actual_capabilities: Identify the VitePress directory structure under website/client
Point to per-language config files and shared config shards
Describe steps to add a new language locale
List where to edit guides, navigation, and shared settings
State translation rules for source and localized content
limitations: Does not generate new website content automatically
Does not validate builds or run VitePress commands
Scope is limited to the Repomix website documentation structure
Does not cover non-VitePress documentation systems

use_cases.title: Plan a new locale
use_cases.description: Follow the steps to add a new language with correct config, search, and content folders.

use_cases.title: Update a guide
use_cases.description: Find the right guide file and update localized content without changing code examples.

use_cases.title: Adjust navigation
use_cases.description: Edit sidebar and navigation labels in the proper language config file.

prompt_templates.title: Find guide location
prompt_templates.scenario: You need to edit a Japanese guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me where to edit the installation guide for Japanese and what file path to open.

prompt_templates.title: Add a locale
prompt_templates.scenario: You want to add a new language
prompt_templates.prompt: List the exact steps to add a new language locale to the VitePress site and which files to create or edit.

prompt_templates.title: Update nav labels
prompt_templates.scenario: You need sidebar changes for French
prompt_templates.prompt: Which config file controls sidebar labels for French, and where should I edit them?

prompt_templates.title: Check translation rules
prompt_templates.prompt: Summarize the translation rules and what must remain unchanged when localizing content.

output_examples.input: I need to add Italian to the docs. What should I do?
output: Create a new config/configIt.ts file based on an existing locale config
Import and add the Italian locale to the main config.ts locales section
Add search configuration for Italian in configShard.ts
Create the src/it directory and copy content from src/en as starting point

best_practices: Keep English as the source of truth for content changes
Update navigation and sidebar labels in the correct per-language config
Preserve code examples and CLI options exactly during translation
anti_patterns: Editing shared config shard when only one language needs changes
Modifying code samples or CLI flags while translating text
Adding a locale without updating search configuration in configShard

faq.question: Is this compatible with any VitePress site?
faq.answer: It targets the Repomix website structure and may not match other VitePress projects directly.

faq.question: Are there limits on how many languages I can add?
faq.answer: No explicit limits exist, but each new locale needs a config file and content folder.

faq.question: Can it integrate with external translation tools?
faq.answer: The skill provides guidance only and does not integrate with translation services.

faq.question: Does this skill access or store my data?
faq.answer: It contains no executable code and does not access files, environment, or networks.

faq.question: What if the sidebar does not update after editing?
faq.answer: Verify you edited the correct per-language config file and that it is properly imported.

faq.question: How does it compare to a generic documentation guide?
faq.answer: It is specific to the Repomix VitePress layout, translation workflow, and 14-language structure.
